definition: to promote to a higher position
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: Thanks to unknown military merits young Kim was just promoted to four-star general.
sentences.chinese: 仗着无人知晓的军功，小金刚刚被晋升为四星上将。

sentences.english: He muffed a good opportunity for a promotion.
sentences.chinese: 他错过一个晋升的大好机会。

sentences.english: Jack bootlicked to get a promotion;
sentences.chinese: 杰克阿谀奉承以得到晋升。

sentences.english: I was promoted to editor and then editorial director.
sentences.chinese: 我先是被提升为编辑，然后又晋升为编务总监。

sentences.english: Promotion is to take his brother to a lot of love letter, in order to return of pursuers.
sentences.chinese: 晋升还为带弟拟好多封情信，以回赠追求者。

sentences.english: Working his way up, he made a few short films that won a lot of praise.
sentences.chinese: 他逐步晋升，也拍了几部赢得许多好评的短片。

sentences.english: The most likable people get promoted .
sentences.chinese: 最可爱的人将会得到晋升。

sentences.english: Brevet is a form of military commission formerly used in US armies.
sentences.chinese: 名誉晋升是美军曾用的一种军衔。

sentences.english: Applicant who applies for second dan should possess valid coach OR referee qualification issued by HKTA.
sentences.chinese: 晋升二段者必需持有有效之跆协教练或裁判资格。

sentences.english: His rise through the ranks was helped by the fact that he never hesitated to decapitate a superior.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不犹豫杀死上级的行为帮助了他的晋升。

sentences.english: The publication of this book accelerated his promotion to full professorship .
sentences.chinese: 这本书的出版加速了他晋升正教授的进程。

sentences.english: Vocational qualification system is a system of vocational accession and vocational promotion.
sentences.chinese: 职业资格证书制度是一项职业准入和晋升制度。

sentences.english: Newcombe was promoted to vice president.
But in fact, most promotions derail you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，事实上，大部分晋升会让你”脱轨“。

sentences.english: The football team's mascot is a goat.
sentences.chinese: 那个足球队已晋升为甲级队。

sentences.english: Immediately he was recommended for the grade of brigadier general.
sentences.chinese: 他立刻就被保举晋升为准将。

definition: to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
to break the rule/to make an exception
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
to hold an office or post
